body_html: @apiszcz I think compiling Tensorflow from source on Windows is not officially supported, but you can make it work nontheless. There are some instructions in the README file how to enable GPU support and here is a nice tutorial as well.
body_text: @apiszcz I think compiling Tensorflow from source on Windows is not officially supported, but you can make it work nontheless. There are some instructions in the README file how to enable GPU support and here is a nice tutorial as well.
body: @apiszcz I think compiling Tensorflow from source on Windows is not _officially_ supported, but you can make it work nontheless. There are some instructions in the [README file](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/cmake) how to enable GPU support and here is a nice [tutorial as well](https://joe-antognini.github.io/machine-learning/windows-tf-project).
